subject: Law
title: Design Patents vs. Utility Patents
description: A quick, practical guide to Design Patents vs. Utility Patents.

hook.text: Apple sued Samsung over the iPhone's rounded rectangle designâ€”and won $539 million. That was a design patent.

buildup.text: Utility patents protect how an invention works. Design patents protect how it looks.

discovery.text: Design patents cover ornamental appearance only. The shape of a bottle, the pattern on a shoe, the look of an icon.

twist.text: Design patents last 15 years and are cheaper to get, but they're narrowerâ€”change the look slightly and you're clear.

climax.text: Many products are protected by both: a utility patent for function and a design patent for appearance.

punchline.text: Utility protects function. Design protects beauty. Both have teeth.

quiz.question: What does a design patent protect?
options: The ornamental appearance of an object
The brand name of a product
